message:
SYSTEM: Hunting_emojis.pdf: Página 15
Semantic change
Source: Fernández-Jaén, 2008
Nice — Originally meant "foolish, ignorant, 
frivolous, senseless." from Old French nice (12c.) 
meaning "careless, clumsy; weak; poor, needy; 
simple, stupid, silly, foolish," from Latin nescius
("ignorant or unaware"). Literally "not-
knowing," from ne- "not" (from PIE root *ne-
"not") + stem of scire "to know" (compare with 
science). "The sense development has been 
extraordinary, even for an adj." [Weekley] --
from "timid, faint-hearted" (pre-1300); to "fussy, 
fastidious" (late 14c.); to "dainty, delicate" (c. 
1400); to "precise, careful" (1500s, preserved in 
such terms as a nice distinction and nice and 
early); to "agreeable, delightful" (1769); to 
"kind, thoughtful" (1830).
(Source: Wikipedia)
speaker: SYSTEM
